citations.narrative:
In the sheltered portion of the enclosures housing a great-horned owl, red-tailed hawk and a turkey vulture, there are
exposed electrical cords of the heated water bowls. In the turkey vulture enclosure, there is a heat brooder lamp with an
extension cord sitting on top of a shelter box. The heat lamp had a basic 4 prong guard on it, but the bird may still be able
to come into contact with the bulb if they perch on top of the shelter box. Additionally, there is a metal strap material that
used to hold the heat lamp in place, it has been cut and has sharp edges pointing up onto the shelter box in the turkey
vulture enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them. Unprotected
powered electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can cause
electrocution, injury and/or death. Sharp edges may cause injury to the animal. Contact with a heat lamp bulb may cause
a significant health risk such as burns, injuries and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so
that the birds are protected from injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.153(a)(1)(ii)  Repeat
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the sheltered portion of the enclosures housing a great-horned owl, red-tailed hawk and a turkey vulture, there are 
exposed electrical cords of the heated water bowls. In the turkey vulture enclosure, there is a heat brooder lamp with an 
extension cord sitting on top of a shelter box. The heat lamp had a basic 4 prong guard on it, but the bird may still be able 
to come into contact with the bulb if they perch on top of the shelter box. Additionally, there is a metal strap material that 
used to hold the heat lamp in place, it has been cut and has sharp edges pointing up onto the shelter box in the turkey 
vulture enclosure. Electrical cords pose a significant health risk to birds that may chew or pull on them. Unprotected 
powered electrical cords that are within a bird’s enclosure allows access to an electrical hazard that can cause 
electrocution, injury and/or death. Sharp edges may cause injury to the animal. Contact with a heat lamp bulb may cause 
a significant health risk such as burns, injuries and/or death. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so 
that the birds are protected from injury. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
